t: Luke 12

In*p the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware*r ye*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees,*r which*r is*r hypocrisy.*r

And*rp when*r they*r bring*r you*r unto*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r unto*r magistrates,*r and*r powers,*r take*r ye*r no*r thought*r how*r or*r what*r thing*r ye*r shall*r answer,*r or*r what*r ye*r shall*r say:*r

And*p one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.
And*p he said unto him, Man,*r who*r made*r me*r a*r judge*r or*r a*r divider*r over*r you?*r
And*p he said unto them, Take*r heed,*r and*r beware*r of*r covetousness:*r for*r a*r man's*r life*r consisteth*r not*r in*r the*r abundance*r of*r the*r things*r which*r he*r possesseth.*r
And*p he spake a parable unto them, saying, The*r ground*r of*r a*r certain*r rich*r man*r brought*r forth*r plentifully:*r

And*rp he*r said,*r This*r will*r I*r do:*r I*r will*r pull*r down*r my*r barns,*r and*r build*r greater;*r and*r there*r will*r I*r bestow*r all*r my*r fruits*r and*r my*r goods.*r
And*rp I*r will*r say*r to*r my*r soul,*r Soul,*r thou*r hast*r much*r goods*r laid*r up*r for*r many*r years;*r take*r thine*r ease,*r eat,*r drink,*r and*r be*r merry.*r
But*rp God*r said*r unto*r him,*r Thou*r fool,*r this*r night*r thy*r soul*r shall*r be*r required*r of*r thee:*r then*r whose*r shall*r those*r things*r be,*r which*r thou*r hast*r provided?*r
So*rp is*r he*r that*r layeth*r up*r treasure*r for*r himself,*r and*r is*r not*r rich*r toward*r God.*r

And*p he said unto his disciples, Therefore*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Take*r no*r thought*r for*r your*r life,*r what*r ye*r shall*r eat;*r neither*r for*r the*r body,*r what*r ye*r shall*r put*r on.*r

Consider*rp the*r lilies*r how*r they*r grow:*r they*r toil*r not,*r they*r spin*r not;*r and*r yet*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r that*r Solomon*r in*r all*r his*r glory*r was*r not*r arrayed*r like*r one*r of*r these.*r

But*rp rather*r seek*r ye*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God;*r and*r all*r these*r things*r shall*r be*r added*r unto*r you.*r

Let*rp your*r loins*r be*r girded*r about,*r and*r your*r lights*r burning;*r

And*rp ye*r yourselves*r like*r unto*r men*r that*r wait*r for*r their*r lord,*r when*r he*r will*r return*r from*r the*r wedding;*r that*r when*r he*r cometh*r and*r knocketh,*r they*r may*r open*r unto*r him*r immediately.*r

And*rp if*r he*r shall*r come*r in*r the*r second*r watch,*r or*r come*r in*r the*r third*r watch,*r and*r find*r them*r so,*r blessed*r are*r those*r servants.*r

Then*p Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?

And*p the Lord said, Who*r then*r is*r that*r faithful*r and*r wise*r steward,*r whom*r his*r lord*r shall*r make*r ruler*r over*r his*r household,*r to*r give*r them*r their*r portion*r of*r meat*r in*r due*r season?*r
